alert.note: Alert for Pike (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 26 at 6:56PM EDT until May 27 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Ohio, including the following counties, Pike, Ross and Scioto. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 655 PM EDT, radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving into the advisory area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen already over the past day or so. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Chillicothe, Waverly, Piketon, Kingston, Bainbridge, Pike Lake, North Folk Village, Kincaid Springs, Londonderry, Laurelville, Adelphi, Rarden, Sinking Spring, Otway, Summithill, Lake White, Buchanan, Knockemstiff, Scioto Trail State Park and Massieville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
